get.description:
Get the AuthenticationInformation associated with the current domain. This includes all the
necessary information to login to this domain.

post.summary: [EARLY ACCESS] GrantSupportAccess: Grants FINBOURNE support access to your account
post.description:
Granting support access will allow FINBOURNE employees full access to your data with the express intent to investigate support issues
You can revoke this (and all) access at any time using the InvalidateSupportAccess endpoint.

requestBody.description: Request detailing the duration and reasons for supplying support access

id.description: The unique Id of the API key

ApiKey.description: The metadata of an API key

displayName.description: The display name for the API key

deactivationDate.description: The optional date at which the key should deactivate

displayName.description: The Display Name of the application

clientId.description: The OpenID Connect ClientId of the application

type.description: The Type of the application. This must be either Native or Web

redirectUris.description: A web application's acceptable list of post-login redirect URIs

postLogoutRedirectUris.description: A web application's acceptable list of post-logout redirect URIs

CreateApplicationRequest.description: A request to create an application for authenticating the source of token requests

id.description: The unique Id of the API key

displayName.description: The display name of the API key

createdDate.description: The creation date of the API key

deactivationDate.description: The deactivation date of the API key

name.description: The role name, which must be unique within the system.

CreateRoleRequest.description: Specifies the information required to create a new role.

firstName.description: The first name of the user

lastName.description: The last name of the user

emailAddress.description:
The user's email address - to which the account validation email will be sent. For user accounts
this should exactly match the Login.

secondEmailAddress.description: The user's second email address. Only allowed for Service users

login.description:
The user's login username, in the form of an email address, which must be unique within the system.
For user accounts this should exactly match the user's email address.

roles.description: Optional. Any known roles the user should be created with.

type.description: The type of user (e.g. Personal or Service)

CreateUserRequest.description: Details necessary for creating a new user

id.description: The user's system supplied unique identifier

emailAddress.description: The user's email address which may be null depending on the authentication method

type.description: The type of user (e.g. Personal or Service)

id.description: Id of the entity this error relates to

detail.description: Human readable description of the error

ErrorDetail.description: Provides details about an entity error that occured

values.description: Successful entities, indexed by their id

failed.description: Failed entities, indexed by their id

id.description: The role's system supplied unique identifier

name.description: The role name, which must be unique within the system.

value.description: The value of the new password

updatedAt.description: The date and time at which the password was successfully updated

SetPasswordResponse.description: The result of setting a password

expiry.description: DateTimeOffset at which the access will be revoked

SupportAccessExpiry.description: Time at which the support access expires

expiry.description: DateTimeOffset at which the access will be revoked

permittedRole.description:
Unique identifier for permitted role. 
Use GET /identity/api/authentication/support-roles to lookup role label/code from identifier.

SupportAccessExpiryWithRole.description: Time at which the support access granted for a role expires

duration.description: The duration for which access is requested (in any ISO-8601 format)

description.description: The description of why the support access has been granted (i.e. support ticket numbers)

SupportAccessRequest.description: A Request to grant support access to your account

id.description: ID of the support access request

duration.description: The duration for which access is requested (in any ISO-8601 format)

description.description: The description of why the support access has been granted (i.e. support ticket numbers)

createdAt.description: DateTimeOffset at which the access was granted

expiry.description: DateTimeOffset at which the access will be revoked

createdBy.description: Obfuscated UserId of the user who granted the support access

terminated.description: Whether or not that access has been invalidated

terminatedAt.description: DateTimeOffset at which the access was invalidated

terminatedBy.description: Obfuscated UserId of the user who revoked the access

permittedRoles.description: A list of permitted roles, valid for support staff to assume, for the duration of the access request

SupportAccessResponse.description: Timestamped successful response to grant access to your account

login.description:
The user's login username, in the form of an email address, which must be unique within the system.
For user accounts this should exactly match the user's email address.

emailAddress.description: The user's emailAddress address, which must be unique within the system

secondEmailAddress.description: The user's second email address. Only allowed for service users.

roles.description: The roles that the user has.

external.description: Whether or not the user originates from an external identity system

email.description: The email address registered for that user
